ResourceHeader.ResourceName: MMS 1 Fast Plasma Investigation, Dual Ion Spectrometer (FPI, DIS) Distribution Moments, Level 2 (L2), Burst Mode, 0.15 s Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata
Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, updated the RepositoryID, updated the SPDF MetadataContact Person to Robert M. Candey, metadata updated to SPASE 2.4.1, reviewed by LFB 20220803

Standardized the ResourceName Format, Set AlternateName equal to the ProductKey, Revised the Acknowledgement, PublicationInfo Authors, and Contact Person list per request of the MMS FPI team, metadata updated to SPASE 2.5.0, reviewed by LFB 20230304
Remove Stephen Kreisler from Author and Acknowledgment lists per request of the MMS FPI team, revised by LFB 20230328

ResourceHeader.Description: The Fast Plasma Instrument (FPI) usually Operates in Fast Survey (FS) Mode in the MMS Region Of Interest (ROI) for the current Mission Phase. Data are taken at Burst (30/150 ms for DES/DIS) Resolution in this Mode. Data are also made available at Survey (4.5 s, etc.) Resolution. Per Mission Design, not all Burst Resolution Data are downlinked, but all Survey Data are downlinked. Planning around Calibration Activities, avoidance of Earth Radiation Belts, etc., when possible, FPI usually Operates in Slow Survey (SS) Mode outside of ROI, and then only the 60 s Resolution Survey Data are available. This Product contains Results from integrating the standard Moments of Phase Space Distributions formed from the indicated Data Type (DES/DIS Burst, FS or SS). For Convenience, some additional Parameters are included to augment those most commonly found in a Moments Product of this sort, plus Time Stamps and other Annotation characterizing the State of the Instrument System at the indicated Time.

NumericalData.Caveats: This SPASE Numerical Data Description is for the MMS1_FPI_BRST_L2_DIS-MOMS Data Product. This Numerical Data Description has been written by utilizing the ADAPT Software Package. ADAPT can harvest Metadata that are embedded in Data Files stored in Common Data File Format that are then leveraged to populate corresponding SPASE Schema Text Fields. Typically, the CDF embedded Metadata are harvested from CDF Master Files, which contain no actual Data, in order to populate SPASE Documents. In this case, the Metadata were harvested from a "Data" CDF, which contains actual Data Observations from one of the four MMS FPI Instruments. The "Data" CDF used by ADAPT has the following Specifications: Data Product Version Number: 3.3.0, CDF Generation Date: 2018-11-03T05:09:42, CDF Skeleton Version Revision Number: 8731, and CDF Skeleton Version Revision Date: 2018-07-10T12:19:56.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Epoch Time Tags in Terrestrial Time 2000 (TT2000), Nanoseconds since J2000
Parameter.Caveats: Burst Data Begin Time, derived from the Burst Packet Time. This Parameter exhibits an increasing Monotonic Progression.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Plus Var
Parameter.Description: Epoch Plus Var

Parameter.Name: Epoch Minus Var
Parameter.Description: Epoch Minus Var

Parameter.Name: Data Quality Error Flags
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Vector of Data Quality Indicator Flag Flags at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: A Value of Zero signifies no Quality Errors. For Non-Zero Values: Bit-0=Manually flagged Interval, Bit-1=Overcounting/Saturation Effects likely present in Sky Map, Bit-2=Reported Spacecraft Potential above 20 V, Bit-3=Invalid/Unavailable Spacecraft Potential, Bit-4=Significant (>10%) Cold Plasma (<10 eV) Component, Bit-5=Significant (>25%) Hot Plasma (>30 keV) Component, Bit-6=High Sonic Mach Number (V/Vth > 2.5), Bit-7=Low calculated Density (N_DIS ≤ 0.0 cm^-3), Bit-8=Bent Pipe Magnetic Field used instead of Burst l2pre Magnetic Field, Bit-9=Survey l2pre Magnetic Field used instead of Burst l2pre Magnetic Field, Bit-10=No internally generated Photoelectron Correction applied, Bit-11=Compression Pipeline Error, Bit-12=Spintone Calculation Error (DBCS only), Bit-13=Significant (≥20%) Penetrating Radiation

Parameter.Name: Compression Flag
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Compression Lossless/Lossy Indicator Flag at Survey Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Compression Loss Indicator, 0=Lossless, 1=Lossy

Parameter.Name: Step Table Parity
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Step Table Parity, this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: The FPI/DIS alternates between two Tables, designated "even" (0) and "odd" (1).

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Count
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Del-Phi (Observatory Spin Phase) Count at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Counts range over [0000,5759] Counts. Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Start Del-Phi Angle
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Del-Phi (Observatory Spin Phase) Angle at Burst Start Time
Parameter.Caveats: Nominally, the Spin Phase Angles range over [0°,360°). Each Count represents 1/16 of a Degree (0.0625°) of Observatory Spin Phase. Zero Spin Phase Angle indicates that the Observatory +X-axis is aligned with the Sun Sensor Axis.

Parameter.Name: Sector De-Spin P Value
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Sector De-Spin P Value, this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: This Variable records the P-Value used to De-Spin this Burst Sky Map onboard. See the FPI Documents for Details.

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS +X Direction
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Energy Spectrum "near" the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, +X Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +X Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 135° ≤ Phi < 225°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS -X Direction
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Energy Spectrum "near" the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, -X Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -X Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and Phi ≥ 315° or Phi < 45°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS +Y Direction
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Energy Spectrum "near" the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, +Y Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +Y Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 225° ≤ Phi < 315°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS -Y Direction
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Energy Spectrum "near" the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, -Y Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -Y Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 45° ≤ Theta < 135° and 45° ≤ Phi < 135°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS +Z Direction
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Energy Spectrum "near" the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, +Z Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the +Z Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 135° ≤ Theta < 180° and 0° ≤ Phi < 360°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, DBCS -Z Direction
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Energy Spectrum "near" the De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS, -Z Axis during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over Particles whose DBCS Flow Direction is within 45° (Polar and Azimuthal) of the -Z Axis (Instrument Look Angles: 0° ≤ Theta < 45° and 0° ≤ Phi < 360°).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, Omni-Directional
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Omni-Directional Ion Energy Spectrum during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over all Directions (Flow or Look).

Parameter.Name: Ion Energy Spectrum, Background
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Energy Spectrum Background during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Background Differential Energy Flux by Energy Bin, averaged (weighted by Solid Angle) over all Directions (Flow or Look), Background Level.

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density, Background
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Number Density Background during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: Background Number Density derived via Integration of the estimated Background Differential Energy Flux.

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Number Density during this Burst

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density, Error
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Number Density Error during this Burst

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density, Extrapolation, Low
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Estimated Contribution (via Extrapolation to Zero) to the Ion Number Density Integral below 10 eV

Parameter.Name: Ion Number Density, Extrapolation, High
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Estimated Contribution (via Extrapolation to Infinity) to the Ion Number Density Integral above 30 keV

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Bulk Velocity Vector during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Spintone Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Bulk Velocity estimated Spintone Vector during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS
Parameter.Caveats: Estimated Systematic Error (Positive or Negative) in Spin Plane Bulk Velocity (km/s) due to imperfect Sensor Suite Flat-Fielding. This Error can be subtracted from the Bulk Velocity to obtain the corrected Velocity Vector.

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Vector, GSE
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Bulk Velocity Vector during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Spintone Vector, GSE
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Bulk Velocity estimated Spintone Vector during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates
Parameter.Caveats: Estimated Systematic Error (Positive or Negative) in Spin Plane Bulk Velocity (km/s) due to imperfect Sensor Suite Flat-Fielding. This Error can be subtracted from the Bulk Velocity to obtain the corrected Velocity Vector.

Parameter.Name: Ion Bulk Velocity Error Vector
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Bulk Velocity Error Vector during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor, DBCS
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Pressure Tensor during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS. Column 1 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Pxx Pxy Pxz, Row 2: Pyx Pyy Pyz, Row 3: Pzx Pzy Pzz. Note that Pij=Pji.

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor, GSE
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Pressure Tensor during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates. Column 1 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Pxx Pxy Pxz, Row 2: Pyx Pyy Pyz, Row 3: Pzx Pzy Pzz. Note that Pij=Pji.

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure Tensor, Error
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Pressure Tensor Error during this Burst. Column 1 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Pressure, Background
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Pressure Background during this Survey

Parameter.Name: Ion Temperature Tensor, DBCS
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Temperature Tensor during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS. Column 1 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Txx Txy Txz, Row 2: Tyx Tyy Tyz, Row 3: Tzx Tzy Tzz. Note that Tij=Tji.

Parameter.Name: Ion Temperature Tensor, GSE
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Temperature Tensor during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates. Column 1 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The 3⨯3 Matrix is represented as: Row 1: Txx Txy Txz, Row 2: Tyx Tyy Tyz, Row 3: Tzx Tzy Tzz. Note that Tij=Tji.

Parameter.Name: Ion Temperature Tensor, Error
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Temperature Tensor Error during this Burst. Column 1 Labels from : ["x","y","z"]. Column 2 Labels from : ["x","y","z"].
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Heat Flux Vector, DBCS
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Heat Flux Vector Vector during this Burst, De-spun Body Spacecraft Coordinate System, DBCS

Parameter.Name: Ion Heat Flux Vector, GSE
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Heat Flux Vector Vector during this Burst in Geocentric Solar Ecliptic, GSE, Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Heat Flux Error Vector
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Heat Flux Error Vector during this Burst
Parameter.Caveats: The Error can be applied to Data expressed by using either DBCS or GSE Coordinates

Parameter.Name: Ion Sky Map Energy
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Burst Sky Map Parity 0/1 Energy
Parameter.Caveats: Energies (Parity 0/1) in the 64-step FPI Energy Table

Parameter.Name: Ion Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Burst Sky Map Energy, Delta Value
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the Deltas are provided to indicate that the FPI is reporting the Energy Bin Centers. The Deltas do not necessarily reflect the Energy Bandwidth that is sampled by the FPI for a given Energy Step.

Parameter.Name: Ion Parallel Temperature
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Parallel Temperature during this BP

Parameter.Name: Ion Perpendicular Temperature
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Ion Perpendicular Temperature during this BP
